channel.title: Mouse over message preview
channel.description:
Well this is one of those useful useless suggestions that will probably never be implemented, but what the hay I'll post anyways.
I've always liked on vBulletin forums how you can preview the thread by hovering your mouse over it. You put your cursor over the thread title for a second or two, and a little box with a preview of the original post comes up. Kaitnieks had this, of course.
I've found this useful for quickly browsing the forums and finding something that might interest me(which gets harder and harder these days).
Here is a picture of what I mean: [img]http://img230.imageshack.us/img230/6643/hovernu8.jpg[/img]
And here is the mod: http://custom.simplemachines.org/mods/index.php?mod=263 -There seemed to be some more results when I searched so if an admin is interested in this idea they could search for more if they can tell which is best.

item.title: Mouse over message preview
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:47, topic:130811”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=181511.msg1698249#msg1698249 date=1187988672]

wtf, its been 14 days, just do it already

2 days you mean

14, not 2, faggot

Ok, you convinced me, I’ll have a go at it after I backup the database late tonight.
[/quote][quote author=lawl link=topic=181511.msg1688749#msg1688749 date=1187671953]
wtf, its been 14 days, just do it already

14 days since the topic was started and you posted that.
2 days between your post about it being 14 days and when Mopar last posted.

Misunderstanding Clarified.

[b]
Dunno why I’m even going to bother, but:

Clearly 20 - 7 = 14

Mopar posted Augest 7th, lawl posted Augest 20th. So I have no idea where the 2 days came from. Anyways, this is horribly offtopic now. Mopar will get around to it whenever he wants. [/b]
[/quote]

Sorry, but 20 - 7 != 14 ;D

Anyway: Thanks moapr![/quote]
LMFAO! 20-7 = 14?!?! OMG I HAD TO LAUGH AT THAT.
Sorry Jme, but I spit my coke onto my screen

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse over message preview
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:41, topic:130811”][quote author=phonnygoblin link=topic=181511.msg1710291#msg1710291 date=1188338004]
that shows a little less that other sites, but yeah nice addition. But heres a question relating to bangtrains post: Do all community members get avatars? If not, is it just mods(all types??) and admins? And lastly, who is allowed custom titles? Are ex-staff(squirtle!) allowed avatars and custom titles? or is Jme special?
[/quote]

The avatar was just never removed from when I was staff. Mopar said I could keep it, although it doesn’t make much of a difference to me.

I only added the avatar in the first place because sometimes if you’re not paying attention, it’s quite easy to confuse mods for another mod. For instance, often I would read a post thinking it was Ron then realize it was Pwnd, lol.

To answer your question, mods and admins can use an avatar.

Also, nice edition mopar. It works great :D[/quote]
Lol I always confuse Bebe and Un-named, Pwnd has his own avatar sooo I usually can tell it’s him

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse over message preview
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

phonnygoblin:

that shows a little less that other sites, but yeah nice addition. But heres a question relating to bangtrains post: Do all community members get avatars? If not, is it just mods(all types??) and admins? And lastly, who is allowed custom titles? Are ex-staff(squirtle!) allowed avatars and custom titles? or is Jme special?

The avatar was just never removed from when I was staff. Mopar said I could keep it, although it doesn’t make much of a difference to me.

I only added the avatar in the first place because sometimes if you’re not paying attention, it’s quite easy to confuse mods for another mod. For instance, often I would read a post thinking it was Ron then realize it was Pwnd, lol.

To answer your question, mods and admins can use an avatar.

Also, nice edition mopar. It works great
